newsitem.title: USA: Destron, Schering-Plough sued over patents.
newsitem.headline: Destron, Schering-Plough sued over patents.

text.p: TraceNET Technologies Inc, said Thursday that it, Trovan Ltd and Electronic Identifications Devices Ltd filed suit against Destron Fearing Corp and Schering-Plough Corp.
The suit, filed in U.S. District Court in Minnesota, alleges patent infringement and unfair competition.

TraceNET said the complaint alleges that various Destron Fearing pet identification products, which are distributed in the United States by Schering-Plough, infringe on Trovan's patent. The products involved in the complaint are the Destron Fearing Pocket Reader, Pocket Reader EX and Universal Pocket Reader EX scanners.
The complaint also alleges that Destron Fearing failed to license other patents related to standards-setting processes.
In a separate statement, Destron Fearing dismissed the lawsuit by the three companies as being without merit.

Destron Fearing had previously sued Electronic Identification, TraceNET's InfoPet Identification Systems and Trovan for alleged patent infringement. In November, a U.S. Court of Appeals denied a request to stay an injunction that prevents sale of implantable microchips by Destron Fearing competitors.
A statement from Schering-Plough on the lawsuit was not immediately available.
